definition[0]: to watch a place secretly and continuously
example[0]: Police officers have been staking out the warehouse for weeks.
definition[1]: to mark or control a particular area so that you can have it or use it
example[1]: We went to the show early to stake out a good spot.
definition[2]: to state your opinions about something in a way that shows how your ideas are clearly separate from other people’s ideas
example[2]: Johnson staked out the differences between himself and the other candidates.
